Arduino Uno Code:
```
// Alternating blink
// This code interfaces with a circuit that has two LEDS that blink in an alternating pattern.
// The pattern changes every second.

// LED 1 on Digital I/O 5
#define PIN_LED1 5
// LED 2 on Digital I/O 6
#define PIN_LED2 6

// the setup function runs once when you press reset or power the board
void setup() {
    // Initialize LED pins to output mode
    pinMode(PIN_LED1, OUTPUT);
    pinMode(PIN_LED2, OUTPUT);
}

// the loop function runs over and over again forever
void loop() {
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 ON
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 OFF
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 OFF
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 ON
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
}
```

Instructions:
```
- This code uses only standard libraries. No additional libraries are required in the library manager.
- Assemble circuit and program as normal. 
```

```
// Alternating blink
// This code interfaces with a circuit that has two LEDS that blink in an alternating pattern.
// The pattern changes every second.

// LED 1 on Digital I/O 5
#define PIN_LED1 5
// LED 2 on Digital I/O 6
#define PIN_LED2 6

// the setup function runs once when you press reset or power the board
void setup() {
    // Initialize LED pins to output mode
    pinMode(PIN_LED1, OUTPUT);
    pinMode(PIN_LED2, OUTPUT);
}

// the loop function runs over and over again forever
void loop() {
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 ON
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 OFF
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 OFF
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 ON
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
}
```

```
- This code uses only standard libraries. No additional libraries are required in the library manager.
- Assemble circuit and program as normal. 
```

    {"part":"4.7k ohm Resistor", "name":"R1", "value":"4.7k ohm", "notes":"Pull-up resistor for SDA"},

Pinouts:
```
{
    "Arduino Uno": ["5V", "3.3V", "GND", "AREF", "D0/RX", "D1/TX", "D2", "D3", "D4", "D5", "D6", "D7", "D8", "D9", "D10", "D11", "D12", "D13", "A0", "A1", "A2", "A3", "A4/SDA", "A5/SCL"],

    [{"name":"mlx", "pin":"VCC"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"3.3V"}],     # Connect MLX90614 VCC to Uno 3.3V
    [{"name":"mlx", "pin":"GND"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"GND"}],      # Connect MLX90614 GND to Uno GND
    [{"name":"mlx", "pin":"SDA"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A4/SDA"}],   # Connect MLX90614 SDA to Uno A4/SDA

    [{"name":"R1", "pin":"2"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A4/SDA"}],      # Connect R1 pin 2 to Uno A4/SDA
    [{"name":"R2", "pin":"1"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"3.3V"}],        # Connect R2 pin 1 to Uno 3.3V
    [{"name":"R2", "pin":"2"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A5/SCL"}],      # Connect R2 pin 2 to Uno A5/SCL

Arduino Uno Code:
```cpp
#include <Wire.h>
#include <Adafruit_MLX90614.h>
#include <Adafruit_NeoPixel.h>

// MLX90614 temperature sensor
Adafruit_MLX90614 mlx = Adafruit_MLX90614();

// Neopixel strip
#define PIN_STRIP 6
#define NUM_PIXELS 8
Adafruit_NeoPixel strip = Adafruit_NeoPixel(NUM_PIXELS, PIN_STRIP, NEO_GRB + NEO_KHZ800);

void setup() {
  // Initialize MLX90614
  mlx.begin();

  // Initialize Neopixel strip
  strip.begin();
  strip.show(); // Initialize all pixels to 'off'
}

void loop() {
  // Read temperature from MLX90614
  float temperature = mlx.readObjectTempC();

  // Calculate the number of pixels to light up based on temperature
  int pixelsToLight = (temperature <= 0) ? 1 : (int)(temperature / 10) + 1;
  if (pixelsToLight > NUM_PIXELS) {
    pixelsToLight = NUM_PIXELS;
  }

  // Set the color of the pixels based on temperature
  uint32_t color;
  if (temperature <= 0) {
    color = strip.Color(0, 0, 255); // Blue for cold
  } else if (temperature < 40) {
    color = strip.Color(255, 165, 0); // Yellow/orange for warm
  } else {
    color = strip.Color(255, 0, 0); // Red for hot
  }

  // Light up the pixels
  for (int i = 0; i < pixelsToLight; i++) {
    strip.setPixelColor(i, color);
  }

  // Turn off the remaining pixels
  for (int i = pixelsToLight; i < NUM_PIXELS; i++) {
    strip.setPixelColor(i, 0);
  }

  // Update the strip
  strip.show();

  // Wait for a second before updating the temperature
  delay(1000);
}
```

Instructions:
```
- Install the following libraries in the Arduino IDE:
  - Adafruit MLX90614 Library
  - Adafruit NeoPixel Library
- Assemble the circuit and program as normal.
```
